resources.string: Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.
This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.
Enchant object or player. The enchant ability restricts which target the aura can enchant.
Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.
This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.
You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.
This creature can\'t be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.
This creature can attack and tap as soon as it comes under your control.
This creature can\'t be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.
This creature can\'t be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.
This creature can\'t be blocked as long as defending player controls a land of the specified type.
Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.
A permanent or player with protection can\'t be targeted by spells with the specified quality and can\'t be blocked by creatures with the specified quality.
This creature can block creatures with flying.
This permanent or player can\'t be the target of spells or abilities.
If this creature would deal enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, it deals the rest of its damage to the defending player or planeswalker.
This creature doesn\'t tap when attacking.
Whenever this permanent becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter it unless that player pays an additional cost.
Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack as a single group. The attacking player assigns combat damage to the blockers.
This creature gets +X/+X for each creature blocking it beyond the first.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.
Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
This permanent phases out at the beginning of your untap step. It phases back in on your next untap step.
You may pay an additional cost as you cast this spell. If you do, return it to your hand as it resolves.
This creature can block or be blocked only by creatures with shadow.
Pay a cost and discard this card to draw a new card.
At the beginning of your upkeep, pay this card’s echo cost or sacrifice it.
This creature can’t be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.
This permanent enters the battlefield with fade counters. Remove one each upkeep. If none remain, sacrifice it.
You may pay an additional cost as you cast this spell for an extra effect.
You may cast this spell from your graveyard by paying its flashback cost. Then exile it.
If you discard this card, you may cast it for its madness cost instead of putting it into your graveyard.
This creature can’t be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.
You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up at any time for its morph cost.
As this creature enters the battlefield, reveal any number of cards from your hand that share a type with it. It enters with that many +1/+1 counters.
Whenever this creature attacks, you may have target creature the defending player controls untap and block it if able.
When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each permanent of a specified type you control.
Choose all options of this spell instead of one by paying its entwine cost.
This creature enters the battlefield with +1/+1 counters. When it dies, move its counters to another artifact creature.
This permanent enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter for each color of mana spent to cast it.
Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +X/+X until end of turn.
When this creature dies, you may return a Spirit card with lesser mana value from your graveyard to your hand.
You may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost to add its effect to another spell.
You may cast this spell by sacrificing a specific type of creature to reduce its cost.
Return an unblocked attacker to your hand to put this creature onto the battlefield tapped and attacking.
You can\'t cast spells for the rest of the game. At the beginning of each of your upkeeps, copy this spell.
Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap pays for {1} or one mana of its color.
If you would draw a card, you may instead return this card from your graveyard to your hand by putting cards from your library into your graveyard.
Pay this card’s transmute cost, discard it, and search your library for a card with the same mana value.
If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with additional +1/+1 counters.
When this creature dies, exile it haunting another creature. When that creature dies, it triggers an effect.
When you cast this spell, you may pay its replicate cost any number of times. Copy it for each time you paid.
During your upkeep, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its forecast cost to get a special effect.
This creature enters with +1/+1 counters. When another creature enters, you may move a counter onto it.
When a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay a cost to return this card from your graveyard to your hand.
When you cast this spell, reveal the top cards of your library. If they have the same name, you may cast them without paying their costs.
As long as this spell is on the stack, players can\'t cast spells or activate abilities that aren\'t mana abilities.
Exile this card with time counters. Remove one each upkeep. When none remain, cast it without paying its cost.
This permanent enters with time counters. Remove one each upkeep. When none remain, sacrifice it.
If a source would deal damage to this creature, prevent X of that damage.
Pay the swap cost to exchange this Aura with an Aura in your hand.
Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1} of its cost.
Attach this artifact to a land you control for its fortify cost.
If this creature isn’t blocked, it gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
When you cast this spell, copy it for each permanent put into a graveyard this turn.
Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, that player gets poison counters.
Sacrifice this permanent: Search your library for a card with the same mana value, reveal it, and put it onto the battlefield.
When this enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another permanent you control.
This creature is every creature type at all times.
You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, sacrifice it when it enters the battlefield.
When you cast this spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card with lesser mana value. You may cast it without paying its cost.

This permanent enters the battlefield tapped. When it does, look at the top four cards of your library, exile one face down, then put the rest on the bottom in any order. You may play the exiled card without paying its mana cost when a specified condition is met.
You may cast this spell for its prowl cost if you dealt combat damage to a player this turn with a creature that shares a type with it.
Discard this card and pay its reinforce cost to put +1/+1 counters on a target creature.
As you cast this spell, you may tap two untapped creatures you control that share a color with it. If you do, copy it.
When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner\'s control with a -1/-1 counter on it.
This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.
You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.
As this creature enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. It enters with that many +1/+1 counters.
Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Pay this card\'s unearth cost to return it from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield.
Whenever this creature attacks, defending player sacrifices X permanents.
Pay the level up cost to put a level counter on this creature. It gains new abilities as its level increases.
If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast it again without paying its mana cost.
If enchanted creature would be destroyed, remove all damage from it and destroy this Aura instead.
This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.
Whenever this creature attacks, other attacking creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
When this Equipment enters the battlefield, create a 0/0 black Germ creature token, then attach this Equipment to it.
When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner\'s control with a +1/+1 counter on it.
You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it\'s the first card you drew this turn.
When this creature enters the battlefield, you may pair it with another unpaired creature you control. As long as they remain paired, both gain a special ability.
You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, replace all instances of \'target\' with \'each\'.
Exile this card from your graveyard and pay its scavenge cost to put +1/+1 counters on a target creature equal to this card’s power.
You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter. If you do, it can\'t block.
When you cast this spell, exile it encoded on a creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player, you may cast a copy of the encoded spell for free.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if it has greater power or toughness than this creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.
Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {B/W}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.
You may cast both halves of this split card together if you pay both of their mana costs.
You may cast this spell for its bestow cost. If you do, it becomes an Aura and gives its abilities to the enchanted creature.
As this creature enters the battlefield, an opponent may choose to pay its tribute cost. If they don’t, it gains an extra effect.
Whenever this creature attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
You may secretly choose a card name as this conspiracy enters the game. You may reveal the chosen name at any time to apply an effect.
Pay the outlast cost and tap this creature to put a +1/+1 counter on it. Activate only as a sorcery.
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it’s returned to your hand at the beginning of the next end step.
When this creature enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice another creature to activate an additional effect.
This creature can\'t be blocked except by two or more creatures.
When this creature deals combat damage to a player for the first time, put a number of +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes renowned.
You may cast this spell for its awaken cost. If you do, put a number of +1/+1 counters on a land you control, and it becomes a creature.
This card has no color, even if it has colored mana in its casting cost.
Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles the top card of their library.
Whenever this creature attacks, for each opponent other than the defending player, create a token that’s a copy of this creature and is attacking that opponent.
You may cast this spell for its surge cost if you or a teammate has cast another spell this turn.
This creature can’t be blocked by creatures with greater power.
You may cast this spell by sacrificing a creature and paying the emerge cost reduced by that creature’s mana value.
Pay the escalate cost to choose additional modes beyond the first on this spell.
Whenever this creature attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each opponent you attacked this combat.
Tap any number of creatures with total power equal to or greater than this Vehicle’s crew cost to make it a creature until end of turn.
When this creature enters the battlefield, put a number of +1/+1 counters on it or create that many 1/1 Servo artifact creature tokens.
You can have two commanders if both have partner.
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each opponent you have.
Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap pays for {1}.
You may cast this spell from your graveyard. Then exile it.
Exile this card from your graveyard and pay its embalm cost to create a token that’s a copy of it, except it’s a white Zombie in addition to its other types.
Exile this card from your graveyard and pay its eternalize cost to create a token that’s a copy of it, except it’s a 4/4 black Zombie in addition to its other types.
Whenever this creature becomes blocked, defending player loses life equal to its afflict value.
If you control ten or more permanents, you get the city\'s blessing for the rest of the game.
Another player may help you pay for this spell’s cost.
You may cast this card from your graveyard by paying its mana cost and discarding a card. Then exile it.
Whenever this creature attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on target attacking creature with lesser power.
When this creature dies, create a number of 1/1 white and black Spirit creature tokens with flying equal to its afterlife value.
This creature enters the battlefield with your choice of a +1/+1 counter or haste.
You may cast this spell for its spectacle cost if an opponent lost life this turn.
You may cast this card from your graveyard for its escape cost by exiling a number of other cards from your graveyard.
If you choose this card as your companion, you may cast it from outside the game if your starting deck follows its restriction.
You may cast this spell for its mutate cost. If you do, place it over or under a non-human creature you control. It keeps the abilities of the card on top.
Exile this card from your graveyard and pay its encore cost. For each opponent, create a token copy of it that attacks them. Sacrifice the tokens at end of turn.
Activate this ability only if this creature attacked this turn and only once per turn.
During your turn, you may pay {2} and exile this card from your hand face down. You may cast it later for its foretell cost.
When you cast this spell, you may copy it. If you do, choose an opponent to also copy it.
Daybound: If a player casts no spells during their turn, it becomes night next turn. Nightbound: If a player casts at least two spells during their turn, it becomes day next turn.
You may cast this card from your graveyard transformed for its disturb cost.
A creature with decayed can’t block. When it attacks, sacrifice it at end of combat.
You may cast this spell for its cleave cost to remove certain words in its rules text.
Whenever this creature attacks with another creature that has greater power, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
This permanent can be paid with either its normal mana cost or two life for each phyrexian mana symbol. If life was paid, it enters with a -1/-1 counter.
Attach this Equipment to a creature you control, or unattach it to make it a creature.
You may cast this spell for its blitz cost. If you do, it gains haste and “When this creature dies, draw a card.” Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.
As you cast this spell, you may sacrifice a creature with power N or greater. If you do, copy this spell.
As this creature attacks, you may tap an untapped creature you control without summoning sickness. This creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the tapped creature\'s power.
When this Saga enters the battlefield, you may have it start on any chapter.
If X is 5 or more when you cast this spell, draw a card when it enters the battlefield.
As an additional cost to cast this spell, you may pay its squad cost any number of times. For each time paid, create a token that’s a copy of it.
Each creature assigns combat damage as if it weren’t blocked.
Reveal the top card of your library. If it’s a land, put it into play. Otherwise, put it on the bottom of your library.
You may cast this spell for its prototype cost. If you do, it has the specified mana cost, power, and toughness.
As long as it’s your turn, this Vehicle is also a creature.
You may cast this card converted for its alternative cost.
Image of More Than Meets the Eye
When this Equipment enters the battlefield, create a 2/2 red Rebel creature token, then attach this Equipment to it.
Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, that player gets poison counters equal to its toxic value.
When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature. If it’s another creature, it gains this creature’s abilities until end of turn.
As you cast this spell, you may sacrifice an artifact, enchantment, or token for an additional effect.
Exile the specified permanents or cards from your graveyard to transform this card.
You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up at any time for its disguise cost.
This ability represents the completion of a puzzle or objective in the game.
You may exile this card from your hand. You may cast it on a later turn for free.
Attach this ability to a creature, allowing it to be mounted by another creature.
Choose multiple modes of this spell by paying additional costs.
This creature can move freely across obstacles and difficult terrain.
This effect grants a permanent or temporary bonus to another entity.
Creates a token or effect representing a child version of the original entity.
This ability represents an effect that will trigger or resolve in the near future.
A condition where a creature or effect is temporarily drained or unable to act until refreshed.
This effect increases the movement or action potential of a creature or spell.
A powerful effect that activates all Vehicles or similar mechanics simultaneously.
A rotating format featuring the most recent sets (typically from the last two years). It is the most common format in official tournaments.
Not an official format, but it may refer to experimental playtesting with unreleased cards or mechanics.
A digital-only format exclusive to MTG Arena. It includes all legal cards in Arena without rotation.
A digital format in MTG Arena that allows playing with all available cards on the platform, including Alchemy cards.
A singleton format (one copy per card, except basic lands) exclusive to MTG Arena, featuring 100-card decks without a commander.
A non-rotating format that includes all cards from Return to Ravnica (2012) onward, without Standard restrictions.
A digital version of Pioneer in MTG Arena. It only uses cards available on the platform, aiming to expand until it fully matches Pioneer.
A non-rotating format that includes all cards from Eighth Edition (2003) onward. It is highly popular in tournaments and offers a wide variety of strategies.
An eternal format that allows all Magic cards (except banned ones). It has restriction lists but enables powerful combinations.
A format where only common cards can be played. It is available both in paper and digital (MTGO and Arena).
An eternal format where all cards are legal, including the most powerful ones in Magic\'s history. Some cards are restricted to one copy per deck.
An unofficial MTGO format where only cards priced at 0.01 tix in the digital market can be played.
A casual multiplayer format with 100-card decks and a legendary commander. Only one copy of each card is allowed, except for basic lands.
A format similar to Commander, but with a 60-card deck and a "signature spell" associated with the Planeswalker commander.
A Brawl variant that only allows Standard-legal cards.
A Commander variant with 60-card decks and no multiplayer restrictions. It is played both in paper and on MTG Arena.
A digital format in MTG Arena featuring exclusive and dynamically balanced cards. Similar to Historic but with modified cards.
A Commander variant where all cards must be commons, except for the commander, which can be an uncommon.
A competitive 1v1 version of Commander with specific rules and a unique ban list.
A format featuring only older sets (generally 1993\-1994). Variations exist depending on the specific rules used.
A format that allows cards from Fourth Edition to M15 but excludes Modern. Focused on classic strategies.
Not a widely recognized format, but it may refer to playing Commander with rules from before certain official changes.
